intro: Clidemia erostrata, commonly known as the redstem false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy underside and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Clidemia erostrata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
